Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: EmmaOLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location - 1 minute walk to Kings Cross St Pancras stations and just a short tube ride away from Covent Garden. We stayed for two nights and had room 38 – right at the top of the building. It was all spotlessly clean and looked as if it had been recently refurbished. The room was very small and the ‘double bed’ was more like a 3 / 4 size, but for just a short stay it was perfect. The bathroom was also tiny, but the shower was very good and the towels were changed daily. The tariff included breakfast but we didn’t use this because we were too busy. From what I could see guests were escorted to the sister hotel nearby for this. Would definitely stay here again if I needed a decent value (for central London), excellently located base to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Handy hotel in central London clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: 19wendycooper67
Reviews.Content: 2 min from Kings Cross stn, room very small but very clean, and as a base for a 3 day stopover whilst on a training course it did the job! Staff were friendly. Only for the fit though as a winding steep staircase led to rooms and mine was top floor. Pillows were anazing and although small, the room had all I needed!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel, we would stay again without a doubt!”
Reviews.Author: debra m
Reviews.Content: We were actually booked to stay at Albion House but on arrival were given a room at the Melville which is on same street. We arrived at 9.00am and were able to book in at this time which was great for us! The gentleman on reception was courteous and friendly, reception area was immaculate we were given a room looking out onto the garden in Argyle Square it was lovely. The room it self was small but enough space for our stay, The rooms were spotless clean, the beds were so comfortable! really nicely decorated. the location of hotel is perfect for trains and tube literally across the road from Kings cross but off the main road. we would stay here again without a doubt nice clean hotel with helpful and friendly staff. top marks from us

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: Rich087
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Melville near Kings cross last week for 2 nights, location was Fab , 1 minute from underground. Rooms very clean, beds lovely, reception beyond helpful...could not ask for any more for the money we paid. Its definatley Londons best kept secret !! Rich Business traveller

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotels - Good location”
Reviews.Author: Roberto M
Reviews.Content: Everytime I have to go to London I know where to book! Melville Hotel, Excelsior Hotel and Albion House Hotel all located in a wonderful square by King's Cross tube. I had a wonderful room at Melville facing Argyle Square, very comfortable bed, nice big shower. People are really friendly at desk and at breakfast...thanks Patrick, we'll be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Stuart R. centrally located near to major railway stations”
Reviews.Author: stuart R
Reviews.Content: Easy 5min walk from Euston St Pancras and kings Cross stations. pleanty of palces to eat nearby. wecloming and efficient staff istrongly recommend staying here you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “My regular stays at Hotel Melville”
Reviews.Author: rod p
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this hotel for business trips. Everything is efficient (rooms always ready on time and very comfortable, internet easy to access, staff very friendly). Its location is perfect for anyone arriving at Kings Cross as its a stones throw from the station and surrounded by pubs, bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in London!”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: Melville has been recently refurbished to a high standard. Very nice and welcoming new reception area. Very comfortable accommodation within easy reach of St Pancras, Kings Cross and Euston stations, just minutes walk away. Staff are very accommodating, friendly and helpful. A great place to stay and highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thomas G
Reviews.Content: Staff is very nice and hotel fully reformed. Location on little square with lawns, trees, animals and kids playing Basket ball, 300m from King's Cross, St Pancrass, the Eurostar station and no more than Northerne, Victoria, Jubilee, Hammersmith, Circle and Picadilly tube lines !!! To be recommended. I'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Best place in London!”
Reviews.Author: Patri11211
Reviews.Content: I've been in several accommodations in London and this one is the best! Rooms are clean and very well decorated. Location can't be better, close to main lines of tube, bus and train. Staff is lovely and very helpful. And the best of all is its price, budget rates for a high quality hotel! I strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: SMB186334
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Melville/Albion every time I visit London or need to stay overnight for travel connections. It is perfectly located next to St Pancras and tube, the square is very quiet, you can open the windows and although the rooms are small they are well designed and very clean. Susan

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished to high standard and very convenient for Eurostar and trips in London”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight before a trip on Eurostar. Hotel recently refurbished to a high standard. We had a room on first floor overlooking a small park. It was well presented, had a very comfortable bed and also a good sized shower in the small ensuite. Room also had a good sized flat screen TV. Location is great for both St Pancreas for Eurostar trips and also close to Kings Cross for mainline and underground connections. Both just 3 minutes walk away. Hotel located away from main road traffic and noise Staff were very helpful We would certainly use this hotel again for an overnight stay

Reviews.Title: “Hideous!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren B
Reviews.Content: Initially arriving at the hotel, the reception looked modern and clean. We had to leave baggage as we were too early to check-in. Therefore the man working on the desk took us through to a room in the back of the hotel. Anyone could get to this room as the room was unlocked and no tags were issued with the bags to say which bags belonged to us. My first impressions of the room were fairly good, very small room but do-able. There was a large mirror, however, it was 6 foot up the wall therefore being 5'6 i could not use the mirror. The major problems happened at night time. We stayed for two nights from New Years eve so expected some noise as people would obviously be out celebrating into early hours. However, the noise ran throughout the night and the walls were extremely thin (presumably plaster walls due to the design of the old house) we could hear every step taken up the stairs through the night. Also, every so often there would be this tremendous sound of water flooding which sounded like it was in our room. I rushed to turn the light on, only to realise it was probably in the wall pipes. However, it was extremely loud and quite frightening, waking me up every time someone went to the toilet above us. On the second night, the noise from other guests was very loud. (Around 4am for a couple of hours)There was shouting, howling, singing, laughing, music, knocking on doors from one large group of foreign boys.(the guests making the noise kept moving about through the halls and the stairway and outside our room where it sounded like they were in our room). I went downstairs to see if there was any staff to complain to at 5am. However, there was no one around to talk to and I had no sleep, for the second night. In the morning we went to the desk to check out and my partner mentioned the room opposite were extremely loud and we had no sleep. The man on the desk was watching football on his computer and he simply said ' well you should have come downstairs' and we counter- argued that we did and there was no one there to complain to. He just shook his head and left us to make our own way out after leaving our suitcases in the unlocked room. The service was very low for a hotel and I advise anyone to think again when booking this hotel. I payed a considerable amount of money for two nights of no sleep and a lack of care and enthusiasm for the guests. I was extremely angry at the hotel for not doing anything about the noise for two nights on the run and for not acknowledging an apology was needed for ruining an anniversary for my partner and I. The only plus point to this hotel was its location which was outside kings Cross station, however I was deeply upset and tired after spending two nights at this hotel that my trip wasnâ€™t enjoyed as much as it should have been.

Reviews.Title: “The best things come in small packages...”
Reviews.Author: sarahNorwich86
Reviews.Content: We also booked the Albion House Hotel but were put in the Melville...and after staying in the Albion the week before, the Melville was even better. The rooms are small but in my opinion well designed and very pleasant. The bed was SO comfortable, the only difficulty getting out of it for work in the morning. The room I was in was modern, a new and clean bathroom and the staff were friendly and helpful. You do have to go over the road for breakfast and I have had nicer hotel breakfasts, but it isn't awful...the nutella definitely giving them brownie points....and again the staff were lovely. For the price, I don't really think you can grumble.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: WARNING DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL..Stayed for two nights at this hotel 23/24 Nov 2011. Booked the Albion house hotel but when checked in which was at the melville we were given a room at the melville. The room was located in what looked like the baggage hold area of the hotel. When I entered the room it felt very dark and dingy and the floor wasn.t level it sloped down in the corner where the bed was so couldn't get a good sleep as kept rolling into the corner. The bathroom was tiny and tiles were missing you had to have the door open to use the toilet and when you used the so called shower which there was no hook for the shower head (appalling) the whole bathroom got covered in water, sink was a tiny hand basin which didn't even have a plug to get a sink of water. There was no bin in the room or bathroom . Only one cup for tea and coffee facilitys for a double room. Breakfast was terrible had to go over the road to albion house for breakfast which only consisted of cornflakes, horrible ham and cheese and toast which took nearly all day to brown. Had to cue up for breakfast only 5 tables to searve 3 hotels and had to sit next to people out of another room. For Â£100 a night this hotel hasn't even got simple basic ammenities a hostle would have been better.DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Bird box at hotel prices”
Reviews.Author: ShakeyTom
Reviews.Content: Room was an extremely small birdbox. Effort has clearly been taken in producing deceptive photos to advertise this hotel! Breakfast is served across the square at a different hotel. We had to wait outside with others in the street to be seated! Food was poor and service was worse! Anyone considering visiting - look elsewhere as this place really isn't worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZishanA
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by this hotel; from the reception to the bedrooms the management have done a great job. The rooms albeit small were very clean and nicely decorated . My room had free Wifi and wired access which was a pleasant surprsie and very unexpected as most budget hotels dont have this .And it was free ! I stayed in a 5 star hotel last week and they charged 15USD for 1 days access....so i was happy to get this for free and it worked very well. Breakfast was basic but adequate and suited my needs well. Alll in all i really liked this hotel ; the location was utterly superb and i would be happy return the next time I am in London. I paid 100GBP for on night including breakfast and tax ; excellent value...for London!

Reviews.Title: “Not a single wink of sleep to be had...”
Reviews.Author: JoJoWondermum
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a single night before our Eurostar departure the following morning. We were taken from the Melville to a sister hotel over the road. Walked up 8 flights of steps to unlucky for some room number 13 which backed onto a housing estate which reminded me of Sun Hill from the Bill TV series!!!! OH MY GOD.... Shouting, yelling, screaming, motorbikes, noise en mass all night outside the window of our can't call it a room so let's call it a cupboard. Stinking mouldy shower, yuk yuk yuk. Awful experience.....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SincereHodge
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the Hotel Melville late about 12:00. We were locked out and had to ring the hotel to be let in, We were brought into the reception which had plaster falling off the walls and was dark and depressing to be told our rooms which were booked as 2 single ensuite rooms were both deemed to dangerous to stay in due to an electrical fault, but we would be put up in the next hotel (same management 3 "hotels" are joined on together) in a "standard room" Standard room had a bed (flat mattress with springs coming through it) and a sink (dirty). torn net curtains, had to share a toilet and a shower with 2 other rooms, both were dirty, had to hold the shower head up to shower. Shower also came with 2 used bars of soap (Nice touch!) We had paid for breakfast but skipped it because the hotel was so grubby and depressing we could not eat there, All in all a fairly horrible experience, when we complained at reception we were told there was nothing wrong with the rooms, they were brand new and we should see the hotels down the road because they were much worse! We did get a reduction in price because we downgraded to a "standard room". Would not recommend at all.

Reviews.Title: “Youth Hostel Service at hotel prices”
Reviews.Author: manchestersamba
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and whilst the room was clean and new, and the staff generally helpful, we had several issues including:- No heating or control of temperature in our room. Cramped room with a 3/4 size 'double' bed against two walls. (avoid room 44). Shower/toilet door broken. No curtains to avoid an early hours Summer wake up! Told to come back an hour later for breakfast since the room (in a 'sister hotel') was full with other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Really nicely refurbished.”
Reviews.Author: iainbrucemclean
Reviews.Content: In amongst some average B&Bs , we found the Melville. It's 2 mins walk form Kings cross station and looks out onto Argyle Square , a great little park right in the centre of all the city mayhem. The hotel has recently been refurbished and the rooms were beautiful. Brick walls , a lovely modern bathroom and a bed too die for !! I slept so well i was over an hour late for my meeting. It's just not what you would expect and for the money , my room would go toe to toe with most 3 & 4 stars rooms. Service and breakfast was good too. Highly recommend and you'll be pleasantly surprised !!

Reviews.Title: “Felt Welcomed and Taken Care Of. Mom and 4 kids”
Reviews.Author: karenhoyt63
Reviews.Content: I wish I could say The Melville looks like the Lanesborough or Dorchester, but I can't. London hotels are higher than NYC...don't forget where you are. I was a travel agent for 16 years prior to 9/11 and it enabled me to stay in fabulous, legendary hotels for minimal cost. As a regular consumer I have to be more practical in my approach to where I lay my head at night. I'd been to London 6 times..the last staying at the Stafford. This particular trip included my 4 children..14,12,8,7. My criteria was a safe and clean hotel close to transportation. What I got in the Melville was exactly that. The room (28) on the 2nd floor had 2 large floor to ceiling windows that opened to views of a park. Yes the room was smallish. We had 2 double sized beds and a cot. Recently refurbished in a polished style, I could have no complaints about shabbiness. Bathroom was small but the shower provided us with 5 hot showers a day even in the morning. Faisal, who mans the reception desk in the daytime is very accomodating and friendly. Ask and you will receive...if it's possible. We stayed 3 nights without incident...but I was not expecting the World. I came to London to see what it has to offer...and it offers plenty. If you come expecting to linger in a fluffy robe,slippers and soak in the tub you belong somewhere else and you'll be paying about 400.00 or more a night The breakfast is nothing spectacular but there are stores around to bring food in if you like. They let me use there computer to print a tour voucher and check my email and directed me a place where I could buy a phone. Any questions I had were answered. In closing...if there is something wrong let the hotel staff know. Be polite and let them help you. I was always so frustrated when a client would come back with complaints. I would say//did you let anyone at your destination know? Answer was usually no. Don't make this mistake. I was sorry to have to turn in my keys upon departure.

Reviews.Title: “Poor.”
Reviews.Author: misscherieparfait
Reviews.Content: If you want to come here for sleep, think again! Could hear everything from room opposite, was impossible to sleep! Woke up to find we had to walk through a kitchen to get to our ''buffet'' breakfast which was a basket of hard boiled eggs, bread and a toaster. Very poor. Welcome was poor also, told us to go to a certain floor, was in wrong hotel... After a train journey and carrying up our baggage we were NOT happy. Tiny room, tiny bathroom. Double bed was two DIFFERENT shaped beds put together, not good for a bit of spooning.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: yveshsieh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with a 3 years old. Ignore the ugly dirty looking stairs and reception area, room and toilet were spotless, with a very comfortable bed. However, room was hot and we found its hard to breath bcos windown was broken so it can't be lift up. Sound insulation was poor. Room was very small. Location is superior, next to park, 2 min walk to Kings cross station, 5 min to British library, 10 min to Waitrose supermarket, 15 min to Russel Square. I will stay in hotel after 10 PM for safety reason. In conclusion, average hotel, cost 105 pound per night (breakfast included), good for business traveller for a short stop.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: MikeyWats1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend on a bank holiday Sunday as were going to a concert in north London. The hotel was easy to find literally seconds from Kings Cross station. We booked a twin room which we were amazed to find could easily sleep four as it had two very comfy double beds. The room had been decorated in a modern style with lovely shutters on the windows, wooden floors, modern bedding (not the usual hotel sort) and even a chandelier. The windows opened onto a small balcony with a pleasant view of the park over the road. The shower room was modern and clean (no bath but that's not really what city breaks are for). The reception staff were friendly and efficient I cannot comment on breakfast as we only just made it out of bed to check out and get the train home but overall it was a fab stay and a lovely change to big chain budget hotels (as testified by the faces of our friends who were staying around the corner for a similar budget when they popped in to the chandelier that we were banging on about!)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: envirochris
Reviews.Content: Should be great as very close to St Pancras, on a square that was quiet during our stay and has had some money put into refurbishment of rooms. Management is a disaster though. We stayed for a bed and shower in order to catch an early morning Eurostar and paid extra for this hotel rather than a budget priced one so that we didn't have shared use of washing facilites. There was no hot water in the evening from the basin taps nor in the morning in the shower. Disappointing but appreciate accidents happen. On reporting to the manager on our return a week later and asking if problem had been resolved and suggesting a partial refund might be appropriate. The manager replied that he couldn't offer a partial refund as he had already paid late rooms (?), that there was hot water - the taps just needed to be ran longer and offered Â£20.00 off on a future stay. I replied that my friend and I had over 30 years construction experience between us and that if there had been any hot water to be had we would have discovered it - my friend had ran the basin hot tap for five minutes and we both ran the shower for 10 minutes each. Amazingly the manager then replied to say that indeed there was a problem with the hot water, that a new "mega-flow system" was going to be installed in a few weeks and that if I wouldn't leave a negative review he would refund my card Â£30.00. Reviews seem to be quite important to the hotel as amongst the poor reviews the few rave ones really stand out one from a reviewer who has only left two reviews: one for the Melville and one for its sister hotel the Albion next door! Needless we haven't taken the hotel up on its offer.

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: MLooker
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic - recently renovated to a modern look & feel, perfectly clean, practical, the shower was perfect (hot water, good strength), super comfortable bed, ideally located for St Pancras International - yet even being in the middle of King's Cross, the hotel was on a quiet square and we were not distrubed at all by other guests or any street noise. Not to mention that we checked in late (8.30pm) and the staff were friendly and helpful, and offered to give us an early breakfast the next day before our train to Paris. PERFECT - and excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget Hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: charlinej
Reviews.Content: Use this hotel as a stop over for the Euro Star; The hotel is ideal. Opposite the eurostar and the hotel has obviously been renovated. Good cleqn rooms beautifully decorated.I was very happy with my choice and will defenately stay again. I strongly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately Stay again!”
Reviews.Author: jendalina
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this hotel/staff are very helpful. The rooms are very modern, and very clean..... We stayed for 2 nights, and were very impressed with the service recieved. The location is also very good. There is King Cross station at the bottom of the road, which also has a very safe/secure car park. I would stay here agin. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Melville Hotel, or is it "Devil Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Jaggs155
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the start of July 2010 for 1 night for business. I did some research on Trip Advisor, and on reflection of this booked the "Newly Refurbished" part of the hotel. I walked into a cloakroom of a reception, checked in and was pointed towards the new part of the hotel. There was no lift to the room, so had to drag my heavy bag up to the 2nd floor. I opened up the door and was greeted with a reincarnation of my student years in Halls - actually on reflection it was 100 times worse than my student years! It was a tiny room, bathroom like a fish tank, no shower cubicle, just a shower head located next to the toilet. I pulled away the top cover of the bed to be greeted by mysterious white marks on the bedding, I told myself "it must be washing powder, hmmm". I had to phone reception to order an iron, but soon found out that there were no phones in the rooms, so had to use my mobile to call them. When I got through I was told they didn't have an iron, at this point, I suggested that a "Budget" room that cost over Â£100 for the night really should have this on offer, amazingly, one reluctantly made its way to me. Since it was only one night, I decided to make the best of the worst and went out for the evening. On my return, I went straight to bed for some much needed sleep, I then realised just how thin the walls were. A hairdryer in the room opposite began to sound like it was in my room with me. I could even hear their text messages coming through. Got to sleep in the end and was so happy to wake up in the morning. I avoided the continental only breakfast option, and proceeded to "check out".

Reviews.Title: “Nasty!”
Reviews.Author: snoopy000
Reviews.Content: Awful hotel! We were put in the newly refurbished part of the hotel. Room was very small and facilities no existent. Bathroom was the width of me, no shower cubicle only a shower head above the toilet????? - made it impossible to shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 6_8-Eeyore
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel last minute because all my usual choices were booked up, hence a rather steep price tag for a budget hotel. Ignore most past reviews. The hotel rooms have very recently been refurbished. Mine was smart and very clean with a small but excellent bathroom, and a new and very comfy bed with really nice pillows. The refurbishment hasn't quite made it to the ground floor yet so don't be put off by the rather tired looking front door and reception area. Breakfast is over the road in the Albion hotel (same owners) and is fairly basic as would be expected from a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big springs sticking out of mattress, white stains on quilt, stifling, dangerous. Share showers and toilets stink.”
Reviews.Author: angasAustralia
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel online, believing it to be cheap but clean and comfortable. The share shower and toilet were in the same stinking little room, nowhere to hang your towel or clothes, and worse than most of the cheapest backpacker hostels I stayed in whilst backpacking around India in 1989. We found all our windows were open in the middle of November...it became obvious that you needed the ventilation, it was stifling and you couldn't breathe in the room without them open, even in the middle of the night. We had very heavy suitcases, staff said they would book us into a first floor room and help us with them, then left us to lug them up flights of stairs to the very top floor. I felt as though had a fire broken out we wouldn't have had any chance. The lady on the desk said that she would book us a taxi to the station, then when the mini-bus type taxi arrived (not a typical taxi), we watched her through the window dash outside and take something from the driver. The mattresses were old and had big springs sticking out, the quilts were stained with white spots and hadn't been washed.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: mollydog54
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel! We arrived from Paris on the Eurostar and wanted to overnight,then move on to family in Yorkshire. This was a very bad place.We were shunted off to another place and given the run around. Be warned! Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great value”
Reviews.Author: BahrainTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Melville over the christmas period with my sister and was very impressed by the cleanliness, staff and location of the hotel. My stay was well above expectations. I have travelled extensively throughout the Far East, Europe, and the USA, and have stayed at various hotels and guesthouses of all sorts of standards, so when I first entered the room I was shocked by the size. It was massive! Not what I had expected. My room was modern, and very comfortable. My ensuite bathroom had hot water, fresh towels, and was also very clean. The beds were very comfortable with fresh bedding. Everynight I had an undisturbed good night sleep. I was also impressed by the information pack in the room and the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and would def stay there again. Great Value!

Reviews.Title: “the bed bugs hotel”
Reviews.Author: shezifi
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives one afalse impression on the web .looks good but when you enter it is digusting shabby and dirty.I was put into room24 with my wife.At 12 midnight i awoke and was itching all over my body.I switched on the light and looked in the bed it was crawling with BEDBUGS. My back ,tummy ,head and fingers where covered in bites and lumps appeared. I fetched the hotel manager to the room and showed him the bedbugs and also the state of my body.He apologised and rang his boss onthe mobile.At 1.15 we where taken outside and put into another hotel.My wife treated my bites ,but ididnt sleep for the rest of the night. I am now in the process of contacting Camden council to have something done about this problem. My advice ..DO NOT USE THIS HOTEL not unless you want to be eaten alive. Phillip Smith Whitwell ,Derbyshire, UK.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: afishpot
Reviews.Content: I was really worried when I read these reviews after I had booked myself and my parents into this hotel so we went there expecting the worse, but it was absolutley fine! It was clean and newly decorated with fully functioning locks on all bedroom and bathroom doors. The staff were friendly and helpful and although breakfast is basic, I think it's an added bonus for the price. The only criticism we had were that the rooms and the beds were quite small. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who needs somewhere cheap and cheerful to rest their head for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “A better review”
Reviews.Author: HeartofGold7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meville for about a month while looking for a flat in London and I found it was perfectly ok for that purpose. The family who run the place actually gave me a discount as I was staying longterm and the fridge and use of the kitchen (although I admit it was basic with a 2 cookers that didnt really work but you're lucky to find that in London) was invaluable. First of all this is a budget hotel - you wont find prices like this in London so it will be basic. If you are looking anything other than okay place to sleep at night go elsewhere. I stayed in a double room (for single price) the first night, which was a little cruddy but okay and the second single room I stayed in was small but clean. They are cleaned daily as are the showers and toilets which I thought were fine( believe me I felt lucky as I had stayed in a young hostel the night before!) The beds were comfy and you get a tv and fridge. There is also a free wireless internet connection in that area too which is very useful. The breakfast was fine but again basic. I understand other peoples concerns about leaving luggage but honestly you cant get into the place without a key or being buzzed in (a fact that is annoying when you are trying to ask for a room!) I was nervous at first but for my part I found it safe and I stayed there on my own for a month! The manager and family were also quite friendly once you got chatting to them and he even let me send a fax from his office. I also believe you can trust their credit card system too and I often went into the office at the back to pay with my card - I think its just where they have the machine though it does seem abit of an odd place to have it. As much as I am grateful for the help I received at this hotel I would have to agree with some of the negative reports too. The staff can be rude and defensive (I experienced this again recently) which is annoying. The stairs are bad and you need to take your time and be careful with them. The hotel is abit shabby and needs updating but as I said - its good for the price. However the one thing that makes me hestitate about going back there is I did find a bedbug in my room and that is unacceptable. I hope this review has been helpful and good luck with which ever hotel you choose. Remember that there are loads of hotels on that street and the surrounding ones of the same or high level but I would strongly advise booking in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: daudau
Reviews.Content: I booked Albion House but you have to check-in at Melville Hotel which is 1 minute walk. I booked a twin en-suite room for two nights at Albion House and the guy at the reception of Melville Hotel asked me to pay all my room charge first, which I did. Then he showed me to Albion House. On the way, he told me that tomorrow I have to move to another room. He said he has given me a bigger room. The way he said that as if he has done a big favour for me! I stayed two nights only but have to change room every night. I felt this hotel very dishonest. I made reservation in July, if you cannot accommodate my request for a room for two nights, you can reject my booking but they confirmed my booking. I felt they are dishonest because the guy at reception never mentioned to me that I have to change room before I paid my room charge. If I knew that, there were >40 hotels in that district, I maybe able to find another hotel. It was so troublesome as I have to pack and unpack. Besides, no bath soap and shampoo provided in the room, only a tiny piece of soap. The alarm in the room is not working. Breakfast is very simple, they give you 2 slices of white bread. On the counter, there is boiled egg, two kinds of cereal, orange juice or apple juice, some canned fruit, coffee or tea. I strongly suggest you do not stay in this hotel or other hotel under this group which is Excelsior Hotel and Melville Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: NW_Traveler07
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry, but this place was disgusting. I stayed here two nights last summer, and just reading these reviews reminded me of how terrible it was. I can only reiterate what everyone else has said. It was filthy, with an unhelpful staff, and it had an extremely unsafe feeling. I didn't even feel good about leaving our items in our room, let alone in the luggage storage that was the lobby. It wasn't just that it was run down, the bathrooms were what I'm sure had to be poorly converted closets. Worst of all were the bed bugs. These were the worst nights I have ever spent. There is budget and then there is decrepit. For more detail, read the other reviews here... they mirror my own experience. Please save yourself the disappointment and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Most miserable "hotel" I have ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: mh19
Reviews.Content: There are so, so many negative things to say about this positively disgusting hotel, I feel I need to divide my review into sections so as to avoid befuddling the reader! So...allow me to recount the many horrors... On arrival: you can't book in until 2 pm. For those arriving in the morning, this is a real problem as there is no safe place to leave one's luggage; you simply leave it in the rather unappealing reception area. Also, when booking in, I paid by credit card (in advance!), and was nervous about the manner in which my card was taken from me, into another room, and then returned to me along with a receipt for me to sign. Might sound like a trifle, but given the immediate negative impression I formed of the place, it made me really uncomfortable. Rooms: There are no elevators. Neither is there anyone to help you with your luggage. So you haul what luggage you have to your room via the stairs, which are dangerous. There are exposed carpet grippers on the steps, which could very easily pierce unsuspecting feet. The rooms themselves are disgusting. Really, truly disgusting. The carpets are utterly filthy. I would have been afraid to set an un-shod foot on them. The beds are ancient, creaky, and plain dirty. The rooms have fridges, but the inches of grime they've accumulated over the many years since they were last washed would discourage one to actually put any food in them. Similarly with the tea/coffee-making facilities. All of the above, however, was positively sanitary compared to the sink in my (first) room. It was blocked solid, and caked in all manner of grime and gloop. It was so gut-wrenching that I was actually afraid to brush my teeth or wash my face there (I had to go upstairs to use the sink in my friend's room!). Lastly, I had booked a single room, and when I arrived, was put in a twin room. It was not mentioned to me at the time of my arrival that someone had made a mess of my booking, and so I was told on the second morning, as I was on my way out, that I would have to change rooms. Bathrooms: I stayed here on a trip to London with a friend. When we arrived, we were put in rooms on two separate floors. Each floor has 1 shower and 1 WC which serve all rooms on that floor. On the day of our arrival, I found that the shower on my floor (and I don't need to mention at this stage that it was disgustingly dirty) had no hot water supply. The WC on that same floor had no light. On the second night, after my change of room, I was moved to the same floor as my friend. The WC was functional and lit (but filthy), but the door didn't lock properly. And the shower really was the stuff of nightmares. Again, the lock on the door wasn't entirely reliable, and it was even more dirty than the shower on the other floor. Gruesome. Staff: the staff are not helpful at all. Some are downright unpleasant. They tried to make a compliment of moving me to a room on the same floor as my friend on the second night of our stay! Atmosphere: As, by now, you will have gathered, this hotel is dangerously dirty. They offer a continental breakfast, but neither of us was willing to risk eating in this place. Furthermore, it was genuinely difficult to get to sleep there, due the endless noise from the street below. This was a problem particularly on the first night, when a group of idiots spent the night on the steps of the hotel drinking, shouting and bothering passing women. Notably, the staff of the Melville did nothing about this. All in all, I urge anyone who reads this to avoid the Melville at all costs. The money you'll save won't compensate you for the sheer misery you'll be subjected to here!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: Tom994455
Reviews.Content: All good reviews for this site must have been written by the Staff!! What a Dive!! The rooms were filthy and the sheets not cleaned properly. The number on our door had been scratched in with a biro and the door itself did not even fit the frame. One shower to cater for 3 floors and around 20 rooms, and this shower didnt even work! Toilet was filthy with no paper and the light had gone. When bookin we were told we had 'basic accomodation' at the albion. THIS IS A SCAM you will not be staying at the Albion but at the squat-like Melville!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: carlty
Reviews.Content: I have travelled around India and SE asia and stayed in some hellholes, but never anything as bad as this place. Stay here at you peril. Never before have I asked for a refund from anywhere, this was the first time. None of the windows actually lock as the catches are all broken, in 1 of our rooms the door didn't lock, beside this room was an external back door which had no lock at all, and an open drain with food scrapings outside this. Mould and flaking paint on the walls. Worst of all is the customer service. Workmen fixing the room next to ours hammering until 1am, the staff did not care in the slightest about this, because I still stayed in the room!! The fact that I got 4 hrs sleep because of their disregard for anyone staying in their hotel did not matter, and the manager pretended he was not there when I asked for a refund. I am a great believer in 'you get what you pay for', but I honestly wish I had decided to sleep on a bench in the tube station nearby. Pick a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: carlyb
Reviews.Content: I will never stay here again, yes it is cheap, but the staff were rude, the room was dirty, the window in the room didn't close so it was freezing and I could hear the noise rom the street all night. Only one powerpoint in the room which meant I could either watch TV or use the fridge. The bed was Awful, I almost ended up sleeping on the floor as all I could feel from the bed was the springs, but the floor was disgusting. Only 2 showers to service 10 rooms, and the lock in once of the showers was broken which meant anyone could have walked in, plus there is hardly any room in the showers to dry and get dressed. Yes, great location, 2 min walk from Kings Cross, but overall I would not stay here again. I am a backpacker and not used to "classy" accommodation, but this was worse than anywhere I have ever stayed.
